57F950833FF84B169264D5EE3424FE10.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in manufacturing technology (e.g., Passport to Safety certificate, Ontario Skills Passport Work Plan and Transition Plan, photographs of a project, technical drawings, reports, assignments), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement.

56603C2F66B744E4BC2F3A2DBC1922FB.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the manufacturing industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., teamwork, working independently, organization);

9A41DA887FEC496DBA4475E82DC8C0D4.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the manufacturing industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., decision making, job task planning and organizing, problem solving);

A71DA3FD6374466191DEACEE288D4367.description: research and report on opportunities available locally to obtain certifications and/or training that it would be beneficial to have if they are pursuing a career in manufacturing (e.g., cardiopulmonary resuscitation [CPR], Standard First Aid, fall protection training);

F8B7906E5AF44343ADFF0714B9D98C85.description: assess postsecondary programs associated with manufacturing and develop a personal pathway leading to a specific career;

5EA0C207385A494F8838319EDF2582DB.description: assess their personal aptitude for career opportunities in the manufacturing industry;

71249100F28644AABCF8EBC26CD76470.description: Career Opportunities: demonstrate an understanding of career opportunities in the manufacturing industry and the training and certification required for these careers.

4619C85EFFF4474586FC97E61663FF4C.description: use and maintain protective clothing and equipment as required to ensure their own and others’ safety in the work environment.

9BC2EA0D1BE8452081CA1C47B45FBC1A.description: explain how ergonomics can affect productivity, product quality, and employee needs and satisfaction, and identify ergonomic considerations related to workshop layout and set-up (e.g., material handling, ease of movement, lighting, workstation design, tool and equipment organization, speed and efficiency);

287B47107E2C40E297D7F7414A56BFD1.description: use proper ventilation and/or filtration systems to control air quality (e.g., to minimize the effects of welding fumes, plastic off-gassing, cutting-fluid misting, and heat treating);

9480A3AB8D5B4A15A161398AE78819CB.description: handle materials safely and appropriately in compliance with the information included in the Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) from the Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS);

9FF53C56BC1B44D99A4820598BFA2FF6.description: demonstrate good housekeeping practices in the work environment (e.g., cleaning up spills and leaks, keeping areas clean and clear of obstructions, properly organizing tools and equipment);

EFC0E4429E5046F6923C792BD76E68BD.description: describe and assess ways to promote safe and productive work practices in the manufacturing workplace (e.g., develop and use a safety checklist for work practices, tools, equipment, and operations; develop and conduct safety audits and inspections of the school manufacturing facility; design a plan to address health and safety deficiencies);

95321AA8868E46A9BDFFCEF11E3ACB61.description: demonstrate an understanding of the specific components of legislation and standards related to workplace safety in the manufacturing industry (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Act [OHSA], Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS]) and the specific responsibilities of the relevant oversight/regulatory organizations (e.g., Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB], Industrial Accident Prevention Association [IAPA], Construction Safety Association of Ontario [CSAO]);

3C5C6CCDA028452CA03537DDB4CD97A8.description: Health and Safety: demonstrate an understanding of and compliance with health and safety legislation, standards, and practices, including methods to address deficiencies, as they relate to the manufacturing industry;

74579C3950844098BE57F030513B5BF9.description: assess the effects of emerging manufacturing technology industries on culture and society from various perspectives (e.g., safety, technical, financial, business).

212E4E05BB194AAEAD0AE0A3E2B3B7C9.description: explain how apprenticeships, salaries, standards of living, and the role of skilled trades in society are interrelated;

F5DFAC48647344DAB283B1A9380DB8E8.description: explain how global economic shifts are reflected in the local and/or provincial manufacturing industry;

EDCC93B915C347E188D8D6723163B752.description: explain how the local and/or provincial manufacturing industry has changed over time and describe the effects of these changes on the local and/or provincial economy and society;

B622D7FEFF0B4993866A82132068A8B2.description: Technology and Society: explain the importance of manufacturing to the economy and society

CDC53A96D92944E080DEDBABD3BF44E6.description: follow environmentally responsible practices during the design and manufacture of a product (e.g., minimize waste, consider using renewable or recyclable materials, design and manufacture products that last or can be repaired as opposed to throwaway products, use processes that have minimal impact on workers and the local environment).

B042522772BA43F4AC83FA183438F629.description: assess the benefits of using environmentally friendly products and processes in manufacturing (e.g., long-term cost savings, creation of positive company image by establishing “green” credentials);

C8EBB05380DF431E8D26199E1974BE06.description: explain the advantages and disadvantages of using various renewable and sustainable energy sources (e.g., solar, hydrogen fuel cell, wind, geothermal, tidal) in manufacturing;

14BFCF61FD8F4606A87769F90941D1DE.description: explain how the three Rs (reduce, reuse, recycle) can minimize the effect the manufacturing industry has on the environment;

631A67A70C7A47FDAB7F19C27806D3DE.description: demonstrate the proper selection and disposal of oils, fluids, and materials used in manufacturing;

F43A6CD345414BA69047C009105223F1.description: Technology and the Environment: demonstrate an understanding of the importance of using sustainable and environmentally friendly manufacturing practices;

29BE3384469240F9BF95B54ED0942A76.description: use various joining processes and/or assembly techniques (e.g., SMAW, GMAW, GTAW, oxy-acetylene welding, brazing, soldering, tinning, bonding, use of appropriate fasteners) to complete projects

54BDC40BAECA44C0B5548F2DBE832650.description: demonstrate an understanding of advanced welding and cutting processes (e.g., gas tungsten arc welding [GTAW], gas metal arc welding [GMAW], shielded metal arc welding [SMAW], plasma cutting, laser cutting, high-pressure water jet cutting);

50579193ADC44DD494C67E017C2FEC17.description: perform various manufacturing processes (e.g., casting, moulding, coating, separating, assembling, cutting) safely and correctly;

AF50728A32E24EE1A5C447A0EFF24A5C.description: maintain hand tools, machine tools, and equipment in good and safe working order;

B52B76792C494B0888E20D3F735B083B.description: demonstrate a working knowledge of the skills required to properly select and safely operate hand tools, machine tools, and equipment (e.g., wrenches, electric drills, grinders, engine lathe, milling machine) when manufacturing a product;

D9B031BE56084D0E824A5C724533F247.description: Tools, Equipment, and Manufacturing Processes: use appropriate tools and equipment and a variety of manufacturing processes when planning and manufacturing a product to meet specifications

F25FB97DE1D847DEB5055698642FC5FD.description: use the appropriate measuring tools to precisely measure objects to close tolerance and conduct an ongoing and final inspection process on the attributes of the product with reference to industry metrology standards (e.g., using statistical process control [SPC] charts and reports).

5937F5190C7F4202995233E9F2CA2713.description: demonstrate the proper use of advanced layout and set-up tools (e.g., sine bar, gauge blocks, bevel protractor);

CAD4230F341E499F949C7198F89889D6.description: demonstrate the correct use of common measurement instruments (e.g., scales, gauge blocks, vernier calipers, inside/outside/depth micrometers, dial indicators, height gauges) and advanced measuring tools (e.g., precision level, coordinate measuring machine, laser levels, optical comparators, theodolites, master levels, optic levels, trammel points, opti-line), using both metric and US customary/British imperial units;

82F24F04932D4D098410A2C81BA7D8C3.description: Metrology Tools: apply quality control standards when using various advanced metrology tools to measure, lay out, and inspect the design and manufacture of products;

2B0368D44C1C431B9AE13A671B8BD148.description: test mechanical properties of materials using a tensile tester and hardness tester.

299B963CB7034D6AAECADD463F8BC657.description: use the proper procedures to prepare materials for production (e.g., measuring, marking, cutting to rough length, grinding, cleaning, deburring);

8E382E6486CD4BB49273FD7F55145BD7.description: demonstrate a working knowledge of factors affecting material selection (e.g., functionality, cost effectiveness, customer expectations, viability, availability);

29D83596178443EF9860B66716513FAA.description: select on the basis of research the appropriate material(s) (e.g., hot or cold rolled steel, drill rod, ferrous or non-ferrous metals, materials with high or low carbon content, appropriate welding electrode and/or gas) for the manufacture of a product (e.g., low-friction bearings and/or hightraction materials for a robot or robotic component), based on design criteria;

A5581841549E4CC7B57E078F4FFBAE9A.description: Material Selection and Preparation: select, prepare, and use appropriate materials when manufacturing a product to meet design specifications;

EC60FDA884B34E9AB3ABDE3FD516181B.description: use a variety of communication techniques (e.g., multimedia presentation, electronic presentation) and supporting documentation (e.g., prints, technical reports, statistical charting) to present and explain a process design and plan

434D3F8D0D684AD081E7C975B6AF79A4.description: use appropriate resources and reference materials (e.g., charts, tables, material- and product-related specifications, schematics) when planning a project;

AAB2C4568FD94F62A32FBA7E76B16837.description: interpret and create drawings or sketches (e.g., orthographic projection, assembly, sectional, detail, pictorial) that include specifications and information, such as symbols and legends, appropriate to the project;

9C0DAE9C85E0401BB4BFD6126EB3BE22.description: demonstrate a working knowledge of the stages of the manufacturing process (e.g., produce an order of operation chart, develop a bill of material for a project, undertake a cost analysis, develop a process plan);

5BEB2F8518804AAEA04989C7DD90F697.description: Technical Drawings and Process Plans: demonstrate the ability to interpret and prepare technical drawings and develop process plans;

92A4281494A944E2B311EC87F659F556.description: estimate the cost of a project, using the appropriate resources (e.g., material costs, bill of material, estimated labour costs) and relevant mathematical skills.

89C2A5C3F75A435494C225BCABA372D3.description: correctly communicate the information needed to plan and prepare for the fabrication process (e.g., order of operations, availability of tools, parts and equipment required, scheduling requirements, time requirements), applying relevant technological literacy skills;

707E599DB37C4F0D9B01C82CCA30B546.description: demonstrate effective use of research skills (e.g., obtaining and evaluating information from technical documents and manufacturing resources) and technological literacy and communication skills (e.g., log note writing, record keeping, data recording, memo writing, schedule creation) to plan and document work on a manufacturing project;

2DDF93F6526F4BD4B8988B058658A9DD.description: apply mathematical and technological literacy skills to interpret product specifications (e.g., volume, area, density/weight, material requirements, scrap factor) accurately from engineering drawings;

EA4661AB7A2C4249A4D496E0EB08221A.description: apply knowledge of scientific laws (e.g., Newton’s laws of motion, Boyle’s law, Ohm’s law, Pascal’s law) related to power transmission and mechanical mechanisms (e.g., hydraulics, pneumatics, gears, pulleys, levers, couplings) as appropriate during project planning and fabrication;

14C2CAFF8B95406C880484198369393D.description: Mathematics, Science, and Technological Literacy: apply relevant mathematical skills, scientific concepts, and technological literacy and communication skills in the study of manufacturing technology

B5B099A2D006444D9EC04833426E1C1F.description: demonstrate the proper use of various control software programs used in manufacturing processes (e.g., programmable logic control [PLC], CNC, inventory control software).

21DCD768CE254156A473E9815A1387B2.description: demonstrate the correct use of a variety of power and control systems (e.g., electronic, pneumatic, hydraulic, mechanical systems);

73336D17F4ED48CEA81D51F00BB92895.description: demonstrate a working knowledge of how to program computer numerical control (CNC) equipment using computer-aided manufacturing (CAM) software;

4F5730CFBA2D45A0B70B47977C46D5DE.description: Control Systems: demonstrate a working knowledge of various control systems used in manufacturing processes;

B01498AEE8CA45EDB7E7F5A283BD6320.description: explain material conversions such as the separation process (e.g., converting a material’s size and shape by removing excess material); the addition process (e.g., combining materials to achieve enhanced qualities, as in alloys); the process of making changes to contours (e.g., assembling materials by such means as gluing, mixing, fastening, bonding, welding); and the process of changing the properties (e.g., thermal, chemical, mechanical, physical) of solid materials.

73B00083634044CA98FAA418924DCBAD.description: describe in detail the function, purpose, and operation of advanced machine tools and technologies used in manufacturing (e.g., computerized robot, laser applications, plasma cutting technologies, high-pressure water jet applications);

049BC96399AA4FC0BCFD02F92E3711AA.description: demonstrate a working knowledge of correct tool geometry and terminology when adapting machine tools to allow for specific manufacturing operations (e.g., prepare grinding tools with proper relief angles and cutting edges, use proper tool set-up for the application);

65AF62CA63D048938AF406BDE8B92A9B.description: describe the principles and practical applications of metallurgy (e.g., hardening, tempering, annealing);

2B1B35438A6E4644A139C3623F5F90B2.description: Material Conversion: demonstrate an understanding of the processes, tools, and equipment required for making material conversion;

F452AE8BC34A459591263E0BCE66EB70.description: identify organizations that develop standards in the conception and manufacture of consumer goods (e.g., Canadian Standards Association [CSA], International Organization for Standardization [ISO]), and describe how these standards affect the design process.

A47BD1C4DF8645AEA921D98E2231BBF1.description: use technical drawings (e.g., orthographic, pictorial, assembly drawings and sketches) as part of the design process to develop solutions to challenges or problems in manufacturing technology;

ACA8BCDC6615415F85501043B643529B.description: explain why technological concepts (e.g., aesthetics, control, environmental sustainability/ stewardship, ergonomics, fabrication, function, innovation, material, mechanism, power and energy, structure, safety, systems) are important considerations in the design process

6EEF863A560C469DB1D2AA0E040F7E4D.description: explain, using specific examples, how the design process has been used in manufacturing to develop new products, or to improve products, to meet human needs or wants (e.g., development of robotics for use in medical applications has improved surgical procedures and patient outcomes);

95AF193AC5784F6AB6972F5CAAC59CA9.description: demonstrate proficiency in using a design process to solve manufacturing problems;

BF3BD465D62142119A602949DBE9F9B2.description: Design Process: demonstrate an understanding of how the design process is used as a problem-solving strategy to develop solutions to challenges or problems in manufacturing technology;
